review: I am currently still reviewing my recent purchase of the Amazon fire tv system. It was very easy to set up, the instruction video was very informative. Some of the app's I had to download online, for some reason they did not load on to fire tv. But after rebooting the apps showed up.Netflix streaming is a little choppy at times, but it could be an issue with our wireless router. The only negative issue is an off button on the remote or the fire tv box. To power down the unit you have to either unplug the power or put it to sleep through the settings. I don't understand that feature.
author: Paige Morris

review: The FireTV is much faster then the AppleTV or WDTV Live.  It seems to work better too.  Unfortunately, my unit is glitchy and I need to return it and get another one as it sometimes flashes and then shuts off when playing videos.  Not too often, but when it does it annoys me.  The included Amazon Basics batteries DIED in the remote after less then a month... Really Amazon?  I like the fact that it can do apps, the Vudu app is awesome and provides many hours of enjoyment.  Netflix and Amazon as well, but unfortunately the content providers are holding them both back, so that still requires me to get stuff from "other sources" - and in that area, the FireTV doesn't do much out of the box, but if you "side load" the XBMC app you can play content directly from the NAS on your network and it works pretty well.  The Plex app works ok too but sometimes disconnects from my computer and have a difficult time re-establishing connection.  It still seems like I spend a lot of time messing with the technology and less time watching TV - unless it's on Amazon or Netflix.  The voice remote is cool but come on Amazon, they had to know that most of us would use netflix.  The remote will only search for titles on Amazon's own service.  RUDE.I'm updating my review, I have discovered the glitchy video is either a defective HDMI cable or a bad input on my receiver.  I moved the Amazon TV to another input on a different cable and it seems to be working.  Hoping this holds up, as the glitchy video play back was ruining my relaxing evenings.
author: Robert Klaproth
